template.name: Template OS Linux Zabbix agent
template.description: Official Linux template. Requires agent of Zabbix 3.0.14, 3.4.5 and 4.0.0 or newer. version: 0.15

item.name: Load average (1m avg per core)
item.description: The load average is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Load average (5m avg per core)
item.description: The load average is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Load average (15m avg per core)
item.description: The load average is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space critical status
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - Disk free space is less than 5G. - Disk will be full in less than 24hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<10G or {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space warning
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - Disk free space is less than 10G. - Disk will be full in less than 24hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space critical status
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Free inodes is critically low, below {$INODE_PFREE_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Free inodes is critically low, below {$INODE_PFREE_CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request avg waiting time (r_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.dev.read.await[{#DEVNAME}].min(5m)} > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} or {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vfs.dev.read.await[{#DEVNAME}].min(5m)} > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request response are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 5m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vm.memory.size[available].last(0)}<{$MEMORY_AVAILABLE_MIN} and {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:vm.memory.size[total].last(0)}>0
trigger.name: Lack of available memory ({ITEM.VALUE1} of {ITEM.VALUE2})

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:system.swap.size[,pfree].last()}<{$SWAP_PFREE_WARN} and {Template OS Linux Zabbix agent:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: High swap space usage (free: {ITEM.VALUE1}, total: {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured
